website_summaries.verdict: The Fujifilm XF1 is one of the nicest-looking point-and-shoots available and it performs well, too. But its photos and features might not please some enthusiasts.
pros: The Fujifilm XF1 looks great and can be a lot of fun to shoot
It has a fast f1.8 maximum aperture and captures in raw and raw plus JPEG
It also has a healthy selection of shooting options and a good control layout
cons: Some of its best photos come at the cost of control and resolution
The lens gets much slower when zoomed in
There's no option to add an external flash or viewfinder

customer_reviews.title: "Lens control error" after 18 months of not very intensive use
customer_reviews.text: As so many others, I got the "Lens control error" after 18 months of not very intensive use. The warranty is only good for a year, and as you can read in other reviews, the manufacturer is not doing a good job living up to its responsibility even then. It doesn't matter how nice a camera looks if it can't take photos for very long.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fragile feel to it...  but a great camera
customer_reviews.text: LENS CONTROL ERROR! Yes, this camera has a fragile feel to it... because well, it is very fragile. To the extent of its very own lens control design error which is generic to this entire range. Although treated very gently, this XF1 broke and displayed the dreaded "lens control eror" just subsequent to a few months of regular usage; unlike my old Nikon P5000 which I've been using for some years now (and dropped on numerous occasions) and still functions perfectly. I cannot recommend the XF1 and suggest jilted owners seek legal advice to file a serious class action suit versus the Fuji Corporation, for marketing this garbage XF1 product to the public...
customer_reviews.author: S. Bruce

customer_reviews.title: didn't use this camera much and looks like new but when i used it yesterday it says
customer_reviews.text: didn't use this camera much and looks like new but when i used it yesterday it says, "LENS CONTROL ERROR"..... researched it and this can happen when dropped or it may just happen by itself. i even bought a case for it. once the camera says this, "IT'S JUNK".............don't buy this camera............mine has never been bumped ......just sat in the box.....i got burnt on this thing
customer_reviews.author: Luke  Short

customer_reviews.title: i got the Lens Control Error. I only used ...
customer_reviews.text: i got the Lens Control Error. I only used the camera to take less than 100 photos. this is ridiculous. I will never buy another Fujifilm product again.
customer_reviews.author: M. Lee

customer_reviews.title: Great pictures but bites the dust after 2 years.
customer_reviews.text: My XF1 crapped out. A few overexposed photos and now when I turn it on I get a "lens control error" message. It is out of warranty and reports of Fuji's poor U.S. service, as well as repeated failure after repair, strongly suggest that I replace it instead of attempting a (likely unsuccessful) repair. This camera is a real heart-breaker: really fine lens and sensor resulting in surprisingly great photos and all from a very small, stylish camera. As a result of its premature failure, Panasonic Lumex, not Fuji, got my business when I replaced it. Shame on Fuji for not not recalling this highly disappointing camera.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Lynch

customer_reviews.title: Great little camera to slip in your pocket
customer_reviews.text: Camera has excellent color, and is good in low light. Never experienced the lens issue that is sometimes mentioned, and I did not baby the camera. Screen is easy to see outside. If I lost this, I would replace it with the same model.
customer_reviews.author: Eddie

customer_reviews.title: Lens Control Error
customer_reviews.text: Lens Control Error - the second time in few months. Worked for 2 months out of the box- really lovely camera. Then "LCE" - sent in for warranty repair - took them 2 months, Got it back- worked for the next two months and then "LCE" again. If you want something for 2 months - go for it.
customer_reviews.author: MM.

customer_reviews.title: Fatal Flaw
customer_reviews.text: This camera is very nice and user friendly but as others have written it has a fatal flaw. We have used this camera for 5 months and taken thousand of pictures, it worked wonderfully until in the middle of our Disney vacation I received the dreaded "Lens control error". If not for this flaw I would rate this 4 stars. I like a more automatic camera and did not enjoy how hard it was to go from off to fully on by twisting the lens rather than using an on/off switch. I wish it was still working as it lasted long on a charge and took very nice pictures and video.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth F Wyzywany

customer_reviews.title: top notch prosumer point and shoot
customer_reviews.text: Full manual control coupled with smart and intelligent auto modes make this a versatile camera for both the novice and the expert. Fast lens allows for great low light performance. The built in flash is adequate, the rear lcd is bright enough for use in daylight, and the camera is compact but powerful. Photos are excellent, sufficient 12 megapixel processor, and a comfortable grip. A handsome look with the red "leather" styling. It is easy to use, compact and has everything you need for complete control, or can be completely automated. Decent movie quality. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth Cusse

customer_reviews.title: Garbage. I bought this thing for a girlfriend in ...
customer_reviews.text: Garbage. I bought this thing for a girlfriend in 2013 (when it was 199) and it was great. I bought another this year for a good price and gave it to my mom. Less than 1000 pictures in and i got the "Lens Control Error". Throwing this paper weight in the garbage and never buying a Fugi product again.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan

customer_reviews.title: very happy with the image quality
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in december, very happy with the image quality, size and weight, zoom range ... until it stopped working because a "lens control error." At first the images turned out extremely overexposed no matter the settings, metering, etc, and the colors were unreal, like ""on drugs" kinda thing. Then everytime I turn the camera on the lens error message appears and Puctures cannot be taken. TOO bad because I have a x100s and it is a superb camera, that's why I trusted Fuji buying this camera, but I feel let down, it seems like a design flaw, I have seen many comments on the web regarding the same problem.
customer_reviews.author: Hamlet

customer_reviews.title: Stay away from this camera.
customer_reviews.text: Stay away from this camera. I had the same issue as everyone else with the LCE. I contacted Fujifilm and they will not honor any type of replacement/upgrade and because of this, I will never buy a Fujifilm camera again.
customer_reviews.author: Jbuyer

customer_reviews.title: This camera only lasted a year until it broke and ...
customer_reviews.text: This camera only lasted a year until it broke and was irreparable. Washed out pictures and no way to fix it.
customer_reviews.author: B. MacPherson

customer_reviews.title: Shame on you, Fujifilm
customer_reviews.text: I just experienced the fatal Lens Control Error flaw. As a lead-up, camera began to overexpose photos, with weird colors. Camera is toast. There are alternatives. Buy one of those.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Cook

customer_reviews.title: I thought this camera was the best bargain of all time because when it works it ...
customer_reviews.text: I thought this camera was the best bargain of all time because when it works it takes excellent photos. I particularly liked using it in low light with no flash; however, now, three months after the warranty expired, I have "lens control error". Now it sits on my desk and I dont have any idea wtf to do with it. I got mine for $199. Perhaps it would have been worth about $100 since it did work for about a year.
customer_reviews.author: soundsmith

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera Great Price
customer_reviews.text: Found this listed at a much reduced price and snapped it up. I was looking to spend ~$250 or so and this model at the original list price was way out of the price range so I had not considered it. Picture quality is awesome and it has the option to take images in RAW format for those who want to do advanced photo editing. The only thing missing for the serious amateur photographer is a separate viewfinder, but in this price range those are rare so I'm not going to complain.
customer_reviews.author: KJP1987

customer_reviews.title: Piece of crap. Lens control err in less than two years
customer_reviews.text: Piece of crap. Lens control err in less than two years. Perfectly timed to go out of warranty period and it would cost just as much as I paid for the camera to repair it. I cannot forgive Fuji for this. My Fuji XF1 should commit harakiri!!!
customer_reviews.author: Archigrapher

customer_reviews.title: Can't recommend for a user unless you have a LOT of ...
customer_reviews.text: Still haven't figures out to make this thing work. The info booklet was way too complicated. Can't recommend for a user unless you have a LOT of experience with this kind of camera. Months after receiving, still don't have the pics I wanted. After I received it, I realized that I had returned this item a few years ago b/c of the very same reason.
customer_reviews.author: eve in texas

customer_reviews.title: great "walking -around" camera with great features
customer_reviews.text: Nice features - big sensor, manual controls, fast lens and others make it a really versatile camera. Twisting the lens to turn the camera on and off is gimmicky and inconvenient. The battery life is only mediocre, and I was really disappointed to find out that while it shoots raw files, Mac computers can't read them! Still, for the price, its a great camera, and I don't have any regrets.
customer_reviews.author: Drokpa

customer_reviews.title: Fortunately I had my iPhone and was able to take ...
customer_reviews.text: I chose to ignore the negative reviews of this camera until yesterday when using it for work when it started overexposing for no apparent reason. Fortunately I had my iPhone and was able to take the photos. I purchased this camera 11 months ago and this seems right in line with others whose cameras have failed. I had not gotten the Lens Control Error message until just trying the camera a few minutes ago. I am very, very disappointed and will likely use my iPhone instead of buying another digital camera. Don't buy this camera unless you are only planning to use it for under a year.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: This is a fun and stylish camera to keep in your pocket or ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a fun and stylish camera to keep in your pocket or bag. More than just a point and shoot, so count on spending a few minutes to learn what it can do. We've owned this for over a year and used it to take pictures in Netherlands and Belgium and had no problems. This camera is capable of a lot if you learn how to use it.
customer_reviews.author: Terry Mangum

customer_reviews.title: Lens control error.
customer_reviews.text: Great camera while it worked. Mine had the lens control error as well. The cost to fix it was not worth it, especially it is almost sure to happen again. I am surprised they still sell this camera considering this problem does not appear to have been fixed.
customer_reviews.author: R. Fontana

customer_reviews.title: Sophisticated pocket camera.
customer_reviews.text: I moved from the F 30 to this XF1 Fujiflim for my fit in my pocket camera. You need to spend the time to read the instruction book from one end to the other to get the most out of this camera. I own a canon SLR, but this little guy travels with me everywhere and with the F-1.8 lens I'm able capture a flower with the back ground out of focus. The On-Off power is a bit of a challenge at first and I would prefer a simple on-off button. I enjoy the manual zoom and the manual pop-up flash. I like the feel of the camera in my hands.
customer_reviews.author: Gayel Davenport

customer_reviews.title: I too just started having the overexposure problem with my Fujifilm XF1.
customer_reviews.text: Paid $400 here on Amazon back in 2013. It my backup for my X-Pro 1. Guess it's toast.
customer_reviews.author: flax

customer_reviews.title: Very nice camera.
customer_reviews.text: Have not taken many pictures with it yet, but I am impressed so far with the few that I have. I like how you have more control over the settings than you do with other cameras. It is a little bit bigger than other cameras I have owned, but you will get used to it.
customer_reviews.author: B.T.

customer_reviews.title: Great pocketable camera
customer_reviews.text: I got this camera as a take everywhere, do a little bit of everything kinda camera. It's hard to carry around my Canon 6d everywhere. I grabbed this when it was on sale, and I love everything about it. I use it in manual mode or av mode all the time, and it's very capable and gives really sharp, good images. Love macro mode on it as well. Would buy it again. Even at full price.
customer_reviews.author: Tosh Miller

customer_reviews.title: Fatal error in less than a year
customer_reviews.text: Hunk o junk, don't waist your money. Obviously a manufacturing flaw that they are not willing to stand up for. Took perfect care of this lightly used camera and it didn't last a year. Read all the reviews, you will see the problem and it is fatal to the camera, rendering it unusable and unrepairable due to cost. Don't buy Fuji since they won't stand up for their products. Lots of other great cameras out there.
customer_reviews.author: Rick Laning

customer_reviews.title: Great when works..pricey instant camera
customer_reviews.text: Nice photos when camera works, which may be few months (even when treated very gently). Then 'lens control error' ocurrs and it's over..so i'd recommend to avoid this camera.
customer_reviews.author: Kiwidrink

customer_reviews.title: Wish the zoom/power on were automatic
customer_reviews.text: I am an enthusiast photographer, purchased this for my girlfriend. Great image quality (Fuji's famous JPG). The lens is fast at wide angle, but becomes significantly low when zoomed in. Super classy retro design - very beautiful. The only thing I feel not comfortable is the control - especially when you have to physically pull the lens to turn the camera on/off and to zoom in/out. Other than that, at $200 I think the camera is a bargain for any not-so-serious enthusiast.
customer_reviews.author: Liam Tran

customer_reviews.title: Pretty paperweight.
customer_reviews.text: Malfunctioned after about 2 years. I think this is the lens error everyone is talking about. All shots are either very overexposed or sort of white and yellow. I can't believe Amazon is still selling these!!! Pretty paperweight.
customer_reviews.author: Mabel and Co.

customer_reviews.title: Manual zoom and beautiful picture
customer_reviews.text: Extra large sensor is great in low light. Stylish and compact. The lens is completely inside the body. Once you are used to the manual zoom lens you will appreciate all the benefits. Extremely long battery life due to lack of power zoom. The guy from Fuji said at CES that it is odd this is not that popular. But it is a hidden gem. I bought two worrying that they might not make the manual model again.
customer_reviews.author: RC

customer_reviews.title: Circle control wheel stopped working after 1 and half years, Inconsisten Eyefi functionality
customer_reviews.text: After a year and half of light usage the circle control wheel around the 4 way button stopped working. Also this camera was not Eyefi friendly, would not reliably transfer photos. When it worked it took great pictures.
customer_reviews.author: Lyle Spencer

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera!
customer_reviews.text: After you get used to the way the lens opens, it's very quick to turn on and snap the first pic. I am loving the manual zoom ring. Pictures are fantastic and the low light capabilities are some of the best. The film color settings really are a highlight for me. Looks authentic.
customer_reviews.author: Jim A.

customer_reviews.title: So far great.
customer_reviews.text: Takes really great photos bottom line. Same sensor as the highly reviewed X10. Tons of options including manual but I'm getting best results shooting wide open on the exrAuto mode. Just hope it holds up.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Cady

customer_reviews.title: This is a fantastic little camera
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic little camera. Takes great pictures for it's size in manual mode. I took mine on a rugged two week trip floating the Colorado through Grand Canyon and it still works perfect so in my experience it's quite rugged as well.
customer_reviews.author: PMcGee

customer_reviews.title: Fun little camera
customer_reviews.text: The camera is great because it's easily pocketed and takes amazing pictures. I really like the manual zoom and all the creative modes as well as the manual functions. I carry it with me everywhere and it's actually sitting in my pocket as we speak. It's not a DSLR replacement, but it takes pictures that are very close! I would definitely recommend it to anyone looking for a fun, stylish, and great performing camera.
customer_reviews.author: Cole Larsen

customer_reviews.title: Faulty camera
customer_reviews.text: I loved this camera, but after a few years of use, it gets an error and has stopped working. Lot of money down the garbage.
customer_reviews.author: KH

customer_reviews.title: Great Point and Shoot
customer_reviews.text: Very good camera. Takes excellent photos. I gave this to my wife who is not a camera person. She loves it is small and fits perfectly in her purse. Photographs are crisp and clear. Easy to use what more can you ask.
customer_reviews.author: Robert D. Forrister

customer_reviews.title: Sweet Camera at a Sweet Price
customer_reviews.text: Got this item for $200. Great, great price for a camera with all these features! Fast lens, manual zoom and plenty of creative control. Recommend this item!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: The camera is great. Unfortunately, the camera broke after 7 months of regular use.
customer_reviews.author: Marcelo

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera
customer_reviews.text: definitely a fun and good looking camera. manual focus makes it feel more artsy when you shoot and you can change the focal points at will. and the leather looking wrap around the case is a nice classic touch.
customer_reviews.author: briansolis

customer_reviews.title: Broke
customer_reviews.text: I'd been using it for a half year and It was broken.
customer_reviews.author: Pongkhun

customer_reviews.title: This camera took amazing pictures, but with in months the shutter seemed ...
customer_reviews.text: This camera took amazing pictures, but with in months the shutter seemed to have gotten stuck and started blowing the pictures out, first it was just when zoomed, but you could still shoot. Now it can't even be used. It's really a shame because it started out do amazingly.
customer_reviews.author: Michele D.

customer_reviews.title: LENS CONTROL ERROR
customer_reviews.text: "Lens Control Error". After one year the camera died with the "lens control error", no solution for this problem avaible. I'm never buying Fuji Cameras again.
customer_reviews.author: Gabriel Nunes

customer_reviews.title: LENS CONTROL ERROR
customer_reviews.text: The camera worked great for seven months of fairly light use. Then I got the dreaded ""Lens Control Error." It's with Fujifilm for repair...
customer_reviews.author: D. Martin

customer_reviews.title: Worked for three months - then it died, right ...
customer_reviews.text: Worked for three months - then it died, right while I was in Thailand, traveling. Once in a lifetime trip that I was counting out a reliable camera. This is not a reliable camera.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Inge

customer_reviews.title: My Favorite Point and Shoot Best Price Best Specs
customer_reviews.text: As a professional photographer this camera takes awesome quality photos. Perfect companion for travel. Don't need to lug around all my equipment on family trips. There is no optical view finder or hotshoe, but that is okay with me because I'm using it as a point and shoot. Love the metallic build with the leather look and is lightweight. Beautiful retro looking camera and with the amazon sale price I couldn't expect more. A steal for $199. 1.8 to 4.9 25mm to 100mm great specs!
customer_reviews.author: Amazonjunkie

customer_reviews.title: Decent camera with some goofy features: EG. twist ...
customer_reviews.text: Decent camera with some goofy features: EG. twist lens on switch; impossibly unsteady video zoom. I bought it as a pocket back up and it serves that purpose.
customer_reviews.author: J. Nutting

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Failed to work after just one year - well known problem of "Lens error..."
customer_reviews.author: Maryna Kocherga

customer_reviews.title: Zoom in turns off the LCD.  Sometimes.
customer_reviews.text: My XF1 LCD turns off when I zoom in to the shorter focal lengths. I had the same problem previously and returned the camera to Fuji in New Jersey. They repaired the camera and sent it back to me indicating the lens had been replaced. Now the replacement lens is doing the same thing.
customer_reviews.author: SRE

customer_reviews.title: Christmas Gift
customer_reviews.text: My husband picked this camera for himself. It's just what he wanted! The price is so good for such a versatile camera. The retro-style is really attractive too.
customer_reviews.author: D. S.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: So far I enjoy my new camera very much but still getting used to the features :)
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth A Baskette

customer_reviews.title: Sleek and elegant
customer_reviews.text: This camera takes excellent pictures. It does require some studying but it is worth the effort. Its sleek design is evocative of a bygone era. I enjoy it very much.
customer_reviews.author: Isabel Z. Brown

customer_reviews.title: Excellent camera
customer_reviews.text: Love the camera - way better than usual point-and-shoots: 1. Excellent poor light performance for size (better than old Nikon D70 SLR) 2. Superb white balance 3. Convenience of manual zoom for framing 4. Fast lens at wide end (f 1.8)
customer_reviews.author: Nimish J. Thakore

customer_reviews.title: Best price\quality at the moment
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Increadible retro look! Brilliant pictures at EXR mode. Tonns of additional settings (but sometimes excessive). On\off wow effect! Cons: Display leaves a lot to be desired.. On\off using lens - rather controversial decision.. Distance for macro focus should be reduced
customer_reviews.author: Sergey

customer_reviews.title: like the
customer_reviews.text: Received the camera yesterday, Function is okay to use, a bit slow but still performs, like the product
customer_reviews.author: SK

customer_reviews.title: Good camera for a nice shot.
customer_reviews.text: This camera take excelent details, until my pores had a good details in the shot.
customer_reviews.author: Marcos

customer_reviews.title: Lens Control Error
customer_reviews.text: 12 months of great photos, then all pcs overexposed followed by lens contol error. I don't think I'll even bother with Fuji, based on other's lack of success. Major Bummer.
customer_reviews.author: T Keeper

customer_reviews.title: Fuji XF1
customer_reviews.text: This camera meets or exceeds all expectations. It's has an extremely high level of performance for a point-and-shoot. It has a lot of great features that mix with its exceptional functionality. This camera goes far past its stylish exterior and delivers a top notch performance for Fuji in the high end point-and-shoot category.
customer_reviews.author: Max W.

customer_reviews.title: the best digital camera I ever bought
customer_reviews.text: Awesome camera it is easy to use I love it
customer_reviews.author: Marilyn

customer_reviews.title: I have lens control error like others users
customer_reviews.text: I have lens control error like others users. it happened 100% when I startup camera. seems like common error of this camera.
customer_reviews.author: Evon Feng

customer_reviews.title: I love it.
customer_reviews.text: I love it ...what can I say ...picture quality and ease of use , I gave it to my wife to use and she loves it, which says a lot more than you know.
customer_reviews.author: James W.

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY THIS PRODUCT
customer_reviews.text: As you might find below reviews, Lens control error is happening every product. Just don't buy it. Fuji film customer service even not refund it.
customer_reviews.author: great

customer_reviews.title: Indeed a good camera with some flaws
customer_reviews.text: Indeed a good camera with some flaws. The necessity to use both hands to start it is not so great at first but you quickly get used to it. In 6 months of use I got plenty of good pictures and then it started to overexpose (in my case with no apparent reason to the point where it is all white). I sent it back and they found some dent (which was there long before the issue) and asked $100 for repair, hence I had to call them back and they quickly agreed to repair under warranty (I pay only shipping). Now I am waiting to get it back.
customer_reviews.author: Maxim A,

customer_reviews.title: WoW on Images and performance.
customer_reviews.text: I've been a 35 mm canon amature photographer most of my life and had never thought images like the ones i've taken are posible I feel like a pro. FugiFilm is now my camera for life. Thanks.
customer_reviews.author: emilio

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: 2nd one I've had that the lens screwed up in a couple of months.
customer_reviews.author: Arthur Hagerman

customer_reviews.title: Piece of crap. Total loss of money.
customer_reviews.text: LENS CONTROL ERROR for me too. Do not buy, and stay away from Fuji. There are lots of great competitors.
customer_reviews.author: anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Camera aperture lens stuck after 1 year of use. ...
customer_reviews.text: Camera aperture lens stuck after 1 year of use... Now It isn't even usable. And amazon doesn't guarantee it. Wouldn't buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: I like it.
customer_reviews.text: So far everything works fine. Picture quality seems better than my old and cheaper one. I really like the manual zoom. I also like the printed manual, not a file.
customer_reviews.author: J. Lee

customer_reviews.title: Great pocket camera.
customer_reviews.text: Just a great camera. Pocket sized. Wide angle to mild telephoto lens that stores completely inside the camera. Bigger than average sensor and fantastic EXR mode which drops the resolution to 6mp but delivers difficult to impossible lighting shots right 99 out of 100 times. Metal chassis with leather like cover. One of my all time favorites.
customer_reviews.author: M. Seither

customer_reviews.title: great
customer_reviews.text: I bought it for my daughter who wanted a $600 camera - she is satisfied with this and we got it for 199!
customer_reviews.author: paperroof

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful camera
customer_reviews.text: Old fashion with new technology. Perfect design with beautiful shoots, picture quality is good and the user interface is friendly
customer_reviews.author: Ignacio

customer_reviews.title: Very Good Item
customer_reviews.text: Very beautiful Camera Very good shoot Very nice design And reasonable price This is the number most nice second camera
customer_reviews.author: Yun Young Jin

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Low light image quality is not too shabby for this style of point and shoot.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Bower

customer_reviews.title: Lens Error
customer_reviews.text: Like many other reviewers, I had the lens error failure after 5 months of usage. Very, very, disappointed. Would not recommend this camera even at $124. It is essentially disposable.
customer_reviews.author: patentstudent

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Light, compact, with tons of features. This is the best digital you'll find for such compactness... Thank you Fuji. :)
customer_reviews.author: Sophie

customer_reviews.title: EXCELLENT Camera!
customer_reviews.text: A powerful camera packed in a small and lightweight enclosure. Great image quality, REALLY easy of use and an incredibly GOOD low light performance (even at ISO 3200). Also the macro shots are awsome! The focal length range is perfect (25-100mm equivalent) and the ability to capture RAW files is a killer feature on a camera of that size. This is a SERIOUS camera if you're looking for something to take with you and don't want to carry a bulky DSLR (this is my case). For that need, it's PERFECT.
customer_reviews.author: Thiago Gimenes

customer_reviews.title: Nice compact camera
customer_reviews.text: I grew up on a Minolta SRT-101 in the seventies. The XF1 gives me the full focus and exposure control I had with my SLR plus the modern options available today. This is a great daily driver, and if I add a DSLR later, it will become a great second camera as well! I can't lose...
customer_reviews.author: b Tommy Douglas

customer_reviews.title: lens control error
customer_reviews.text: had lens control error within the year warranty period. had to ship it off to be repaired. now that works but i can't shoot video for more than a minute. cute camera, pretty good pics. not worth it though.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: A compact camera that provides fantastic quality photos. It has a really attractive retro look to it and has drawn a lot of compliments from others. Certainly all I need from a camera.
customer_reviews.author: RobertLePoulet

customer_reviews.title: Great camera
customer_reviews.text: I bought the camera for my dad last Christmas. It took him a while to get used to the "zoom-does-it-all" feature, but he loves it and uses it all the time.
customer_reviews.author: anthony

customer_reviews.title: Only con is that the shutter speed doesn't go beyond ...
customer_reviews.text: Only con is that the shutter speed doesn't go beyond 1/15 sec when using flash thus moving subjects appear blurry.
customer_reviews.author: Angel

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great camera same sensor as fuji x 10, and fuji x 20, perfect to carry on.
customer_reviews.author: Jose

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: SLR quality, a bit difficult for a unexperienced photographer. but wow on the possibilities!
customer_reviews.author: Carole

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful camera, very weak
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful camera BUT died after five months... The famous "lens camera error" happened to my camera and I cannot longer use it. Very sad. Very poor materials.
customer_reviews.author: Cristian Franco

customer_reviews.title: Great results
customer_reviews.text: Great results but a complicated piece of equipment. The results and your control of them are as good as a more expensive camera.
customer_reviews.author: robert martin

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful camera if not for the "Lense error". Still worth chancing it because it took good picture in low light without flash.
customer_reviews.text: Took a chance and keep my finger cross hopping that the " Lense error " will not show up too soon. Love the look and picture that this camera took especially in low light condition.
customer_reviews.author: Rita Wong Leung

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Lens control error. Didn't even get a chance to see the lens open. Also didn't come with HDMI cable.
customer_reviews.author: Gabriela Medina

customer_reviews.title: The on/ off switch started failing intermittently after 5 days ...
customer_reviews.text: The on/ off switch started failing intermittently after 5 days, and it does do the up close focus all that well
customer_reviews.author: Robert Laird

customer_reviews.title: Good, not Great - Felt Cheap
customer_reviews.text: I was disappointed - it looks a lot cooler online than in person. It feels cheap when holding. I took a few pictures and picture quality looks great, but I returned it (despite the amazing price) and went back to using my Panasonic LX5. The panny is showing its age, but it works well, and takes good enough photos. I think I'm going to have to wait and upgrade to the RX100. These compact cameras haven't evolved enough in the past few years to really justify buying the LX7 or Canon S120.
customer_reviews.author: David Tweed

customer_reviews.title: This camera is amazing..
customer_reviews.text: This camera is amazing... It has many settings and has created very good pictures for our family. It offers you the world but is also great for novice shooters like myself.
customer_reviews.author: jljscorpio

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice Camera
customer_reviews.text: This is a very Nice Camera and compact It hase one of the best jpeg Process Fast and responsible Nice 3# Screen Good lens
customer_reviews.author: AL-Musafer

customer_reviews.title: A great Camera!
customer_reviews.text: I love there design at the first time, and I was getting more like it as I investigate it through after I got this!
customer_reviews.author: Hyunhee Rebecca Lee

customer_reviews.title: over-exposure problem
customer_reviews.text: After one year and 6 months of use, this camera suddenly have an over-exposure issue. All outdoor shots are hopelessly over-exposed for both manual and automatic modes. The images are totally washed out.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Awesome, awesome, awesome camera! I would definitely recommend it to anyone!!
customer_reviews.author: Blandin Clark

customer_reviews.title: Fun and stylish
customer_reviews.text: Fun camera for someone who wants a point and shoot that has the great manual features of an old manual film camera. Stylish and fun
customer_reviews.author: Myra

customer_reviews.title: Great Service..
customer_reviews.text: Amazing machine although takes a while to get used to it, esp. if you have been using a DSLR. Excellent service by AMAZON. Thanks
customer_reviews.author: aman

customer_reviews.title: Great camera, a joy to use
customer_reviews.text: Great camera, a joy to use. Very small and compact, only slightly bigger than an iPhone 4 with Otterbox case.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Giagnocavo

customer_reviews.title: This is a poor product, white balance can not work
customer_reviews.text: This is a poor product,white balance can not work, it can not use.

customer_reviews.title: Fujifilm XF1
customer_reviews.text: GREAT! Everythings OK and works fine. Very worthed to the price, and I use my amazon prime to buy this.
customer_reviews.author: Christian

product_meta.title: Fujifilm XF1/Blk 12MP Digital Camera with 3-Inch LCD (Black)
product_meta.description:
Style:Camera Only| Color:Black| Product Packaging:Standard PackagingTravel light. Shoot fast. Capture the moment. The FUJIFILM XF1 is the latest introduction to the award winning X-Series line of digital cameras, and is an incredibly versatile camera that gives you the highest level in image quality along with high speed performance, all in a compact, sleek form factor with retro looks. The large 2/3-Inch 12MP EXR CMOS sensor and EXR Processor have been precisely paired up in the XF1 to provide the best image quality and fastest performance possible. With fast Auto Focus even in low light and high speed continuous shooting up to 11frames per second, you never have to worry about missing a shot. The XF1 has a bright Fujinon F1.8-4.9 wide angle manual zoom lens (25 100mm equivalent) that helps produce amazing images even in low light conditions, as well as beautiful booked (blurred background) effects that are almost unheard of in a compact camera. Beyond producing superb clarity from edge to edge, the 4x manual zoom lens ring actually doubles as the on/off power switch and offers 3 unique camera positions: from fully retracted (easily slide into your pocket or purse for easy portability), to a locked Standby mode (ready in an instant, but save some battery power while you’re not actively shooting) to Shooting mode. The multi-faceted lens offers high speed operation (0.55sec startup in quick start mode) and quick/precise zoom control. The stylish XF1 body combines a lightweight and durable aluminum body along with synthetic leather covering to enhance the overall look and feel of the camera. Available in three different colors (Red, Black & Tan), the choice is yours to decide which one best suits your style.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER



FUJIFILM XF-1 DIGITAL CAMERA
Lightweight, durable aluminum body parts and synthetic leather covering enhance the feel of the camera in the hand, with texture that resembles genuine leather.


DISCOVER THE BEAUTY OF F/1.8, AT NIGHT, INDOORS, WHENEVER LIGHT IS LOW
The bright f/1.8 lens lets you capture quality pictures not normally possible with a compact camera. Noise is kept to a minimum without boosting sensitivity, while camera-shake and subject motion are prevented due to high shutter speeds. And thanks to the large aperture, you can also create attractive "bokeh" blurred background effects.


HIGH QUALITY PHOTOS & MOVIES WITH THE EXR CMOS
EXR Auto with Motion Detection instantly recognizes 58 types of scenes, instantly optimizing every setting from exposure to white balance, and switches to one of three different sensor modes for the scene and subject: HR High Resolution for well-lit conditions, SN High Sensitivity/Low Noise mode for low light, and DR Dynamic Range mode for high-contrast scenes.

SPEED RESPONSE WITH EXR PROCESSOR
The EXR processor offers a fast AF in dark scenes: a fast startup, 0.55-second response, means you'll never miss the moment. And locking on to your subject in as little as 0.16 seconds, High Speed Contrast Detection AF captures even spur-of-the-moment shots with sharp clarity at maximum 4x zoom. Plus,unlike other more conventional premium digital cameras, the XF1 autofocus system reacts quickly even in low light, making it possible to shoot high-quality hand-held photos indoors or at night.


MANUAL ZOOM & EFFORTLESS OPERATION
Unlike power zoom, the XF1's zoom ring provides direct manual controls, keeping the zoom action very smooth. For telephoto shots beyond the 4x optical zoom range, Intelligent Digital Zoom doubles your zoom to the equivalent of 8x zoom and delivers excellent sharpness and detail.


MORE CREATIVE PHOTOGRAPHY FOR YOU
For creative needs, various shooting options and functions are available. With a new feature Advanced Filter, you can select out of six special effects: Pop Color, Toy Camera, Miniature, High Key, Partial Color, and Dynamic Tone.
feature_bullets: High Quality Fujinon 4x F1.8-4.9 Manual Zoom Lens
Three Stylish colors: Black, Brown and Red
